EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────────
### Steam Power Generation System at Boiler (8.0, 20.5)
• Purpose: Generates electrical power from steam.  
• Components:
  – Boiler located at (8.0, 20.5) with connection points at (8.5, 18.5) and (8.5, 22.5)  
  – Steam engines placed at (0.5, 9.5), (18.5, 11.5), (1.5, 13.5), (13.5, 14.5), (19.5, 14.5), (22.5, 18.5), (17.5, 20.5), (12.5, 21.5) and (4.5, 23.5)  
  – One additional steam engine remains in inventory because spatial congestion in the boiler zone prevents its placement

### Automated Mining Setup near (–15.0, –50.0)
• Purpose: Facilitates resource extraction and initial processing.  
• Components:
  – Burner mining drill installed at (–15.0, –50.0)  
  – Network of burner inserters located around positions (–14.5, –52.5), (–13.5, –52.5) and (–16.5, –48.5)  
  – Wooden chest positioned at (–13.5, –51.5) for buffering extracted resources

### Smelting Process Cluster
• Purpose: Converts raw ore into usable metal plates.  
• Components:
  – Stone furnace at (0.0, 0.0) producing iron-plate results  
  – Stone furnace at (5.0, 0.0) producing copper-plate results  
  – Associated burner inserters and wooden chests supporting the process (e.g., near (1.5, 1.5), (2.5, 0.5) and (0.5, 2.5))

### Fluid and Electrical Infrastructure
• Purpose: Ensures steady water supply and power distribution while facilitating material logistics.  
• Components:
  – Offshore pump at (0.5, 30.5) feeding water into interconnected pipe systems  
  – Multiple pipe groups (with fluid system IDs such as 53267, 53277, 53278, 53282 and 53279) that provide fluid distribution  
  – Electricity groups (e.g., IDs 13371, 13397, 13423) and belt groups linking production sites (including groups with 8, 73 and 102 belts)

### Research Lab Network
• Purpose: Conducts technological research in automation.  
• Components:
  – Multiple lab units accepting automation‑science‑packs (e.g., with electrical ID 13423) that remain powered down due to current connectivity issues

ERROR TIPS
────────────────────────────
• Extra Steam Engine Placement Issue:
  – The extra steam engine remains unplaceable due to persistent spatial congestion in the boiler zone.  
  – Overlapping burner‑inserters and misaligned transport belts around positions (8.0, 20.5) and (8.5, 22.5) prevent a clear buildable area.  
  – Recommendations:
      • Remove or reposition conflicting entities (such as burner‑inserters and transport belts) from the boiler zone.  
      • Redesign adjoining connection interfaces to significantly expand the available buildable space.  
      • Consider relocating the extra steam engine to a less congested area or reconfiguring the boiler layout entirely to overcome the bottleneck.  

Manual intervention is essential to resolve this recurring placement issue.
